thread.title: P&O’s ‘five-ship spectacular’ sail into Sydney Harbour to kick off a party ‘like no other on Earth’ | DailyTelegraph
thread.title_full: P&O’s ‘five-ship spectacular’ sail into Sydney Harbour to kick off a party ‘like no other on Earth’ | DailyTelegraph

author: Rowena Ryan
title: P&O’s ‘five-ship spectacular’ sail into Sydney Harbour to kick off a party ‘like no other on Earth’ | DailyTelegraph
text:
FOR the first time ever, Sydney Harbour will be home to five cruise ships on the same day in what is being billed as the “P&O five-ship spectacular.” On November 25, five P&O cruise lines will enter the harbour, including its two newest ships —
Pacific Aria and Pacific Eden .
Other Stories We’ve had the wet, now the wind Nsw 0 comments ABC apologises to Abbott for vulgar tweet Television Jarryd Hayne slapped with fine Us Sports Congratulations. You’ve made Latham a martyr Rendezview 0 comments 12 best new cafes for 2015 Food Hayne could become $12m man More Sports 0 comments The cruise ships will form an impressive V formation outside the heads as a “Salute to Sydney”
before entering the harbour in single file.
Singer Jessica Mauboy will perform at the P&O event. Picture: Muse Bureau. Turning Sydney into the Miami of the south — more than 9000 passengers on-board will be treated to special concerts by some of Australia’s best known performers including Jessica Mauboy, The Veronicas, Samantha Jade, Justice Crew and Stan Walker.
The performers will be joined by 20 other live music acts across the ships as well as 10 DJs.
“This will be like no party on earth and is sure to become an iconic moment in Sydney Harbour’s history as well as providing lasting memories for the thousands of guests on-board,” said Sture Myrmell, P&O Cruises Senior Vice President.
Justice Crew is billed to perform at the unprecedented party. Picture: Sony Music The five ships will take up their positions around Sydney Harbour for the afternoon of
entertainment. Pacific Jewel will be located at Athol Bay, Pacific Dawn off Garden Island, Pacific Pearl at Point Piper, Pacific Aria berthed at the Overseas Passenger Terminal and Pacific Eden set to be anchored at Neutral Bay after spending the day at White Bay.
Following the concert, guests on-board the ships will enjoy the biggest white party at sea with the cruise line overseeing a mass production of its new Bianco event on the top decks of all five ships with smoke cannons, white cocktails and a snow finale.
To celebrate the historic moment, a spectacular firework finale will light up the night sky above the cruise cavalcade.
Passengers can book a spot on one of the five ships at www.pocruises.com.au/5ships
Originally published as Aussie city to hold party ‘like no other on Earth’
